identifier.description: The name used to access a file system created by Amazon EFS. CodeBuild creates an environment variable by appending the identifier in all capital letters to CODEBUILD\_. For example, if you specify my-efs for identifier, a new environment variable is create named CODEBUILD_MY-EFS.

location.description: A string that specifies the location of the file system created by Amazon EFS. Its format is `efs-dns-name:/directory-path`.

mountOptions.description: The mount options for a file system created by AWS EFS.

mountPoint.description: The location in the container where you mount the file system.

type.description: The type of the file system. The one supported type is `EFS`.
